com.elveskevtar.divebomb.gfx

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.elveskevtar.divebomb.gfx.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public abstract class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener
    Abstract class that is a JPanel object and serves as the general game structure itself. A game type object can be inherited to serve as either a more specialized singleplayer or multiplayer gamemode. The abstract version of the game contains an enumeration of all of the game types as well as many generic threads that should be used for all games, such as Repaint. Repaint is a nested class that serves as a TimerTask object which runs as a separate thread every certain amount of milliseconds. This is how many of the subthreads are structured within the Game class and all of its nested classes.

    Contains constructors for both clientside Game objects (whether the client is also hosting a server or not) and serverside only Game objects.

    Implements KeyListener, MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, and MouseWheelListener to track all of the necessary inputs that makes the game interactive.

    Overall, this class contains most of the core code that makes everything run. Changes to this class are less frequent and usually more for cosmetic or efficiency purposes. If changes need to be made to a specific gamemode, those typically occur in that specific gamemode's class file.
    Since:
    0.0.1-pre-pre-alpha
    Author:
    Elveskevtar
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Game.AnimatePlayers
      TimerTask that handles the animation of the players (clients only for both SP and MP gamemodes).
      static class  Game.GameTypes
      An enumeration of the gamemodes that currently exist within the game.
      private class  Game.Input
      TimerTask that handles the user input from the keyboard (clients only for both SP and MP gamemodes).
      private class  Game.MovePlayers
      TimerTask that handles the movement of the Players in the Game object (clients only for both SP and MP gamemodes).
      private class  Game.PlayerWeapons
      TimerTask that handles the animation of player weapons (clients only for both SP and MP gamemodes).
      private class  Game.Projectiles
      TimerTask that handles the projectile motion and angles of all the objects within the Projectile ArrayList.
      private class  Game.Repaint
      TimerTask object that calls the repaint() method to repaint the screen every SPEED milliseconds.
      private class  Game.Stamina
      TimerTask that handles the stamina of Players within the Game.

      This method is usually called immediately after calling public void paintGame(Graphics g) so that the game is still painted underneath the reconnect screen which only serves as an overlay to notify the user of connection issues.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NAMETAG_GREEN

        private static final java.awt.Color NAMETAG_GREEN
        Corresponds to the RGB value of 7, 192, 44. Used primarily for GUI.

      • PAUSE_OVERLAY

        private static final java.awt.Color PAUSE_OVERLAY
        Corresponds to the RGBA value of 32, 32, 32, 100. Used primarily for game states that would still like the game painted in the background.

      • TERMINAL_VELOCITY

        private static final double TERMINAL_VELOCITY
        The maximum downwards velocity for a Player.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GRAVITY

        private static final double GRAVITY
        The gravity variable of the Game. Affects every Player's y velocity.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SPEED

        private static final int SPEED
        The number of milliseconds between repitions of the TimerTasks.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • state

        private int state
        The paint method calls various paint submethods based on this variable. Here is the list of states based on its value:
        • If state = 0, then the game itself will be painted
        • If state = 1, then the puase menu will be painted over the game
        • If state = 2, then the reconnect screen will be painted over the game

      • gameID

        private int gameID
        The gamemode ID number based on the gamemode type is stored in this variable on the call of the constructor. This is all based on the GameTypes enumeration above. For convenience's sake, here is the list of gamemodes based on ID value:
        • If gameID = 0, then the gamemode is deathmatch
        • If gameID = 1, then the gamemode is multiplayer deathmatch
        See Also:
        Game.GameTypes

      • playerSize

        private int playerSize
        The total number of players needed for a full game of a specific gamemode. Mostly used for multiplayer games to determine how many players are needed to start the game. Each multiplayer gamemode has a default value for playerSize that can be changed for custom games.

      • lobbyTime

        private int lobbyTime
        The game lobby time. Default of 0 for singleplayer gamemodes and default of -1 for multiplayer gamemodes. Used to count down the time remaining until the game starts.
        See Also:
        GameLobbyMenu

      • zoom

        private double zoom
        Integer value for how graphically zoomed things should be painted.

      • projectiles

        private java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<com.elveskevtar.divebomb.weapons.Projectile> projectiles
        An ArrayList that contains all of the active Projectile objects within the game. Uses a CopyOnWriteArrayList which is a thread safe alternative to regular ArrayLists. This means that while you're modifying an element of the list in one thread, you could be iterating through the elements in another thread and no ConcurrentModificationException would be thrown.
        See Also:
        ConcurrentModificationException

      • players

        private java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<com.elveskevtar.divebomb.race.Player> players
        An ArrayList that contains the active players withing the Game object. Uses a CopyOnWriteArrayList which is a thread safe alternative to regular ArrayLists. This means that while you're modifying an element of the list in one thread, you could be iterating through the elements in another thread and no ConcurrentModificationException would be thrown.
        See Also:
        ConcurrentModificationException

      • collisionRecs

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Rectangle> collisionRecs
        An ArrayList that contains all of the collision rectangles loaded through the collision map file.

      • projectileIDs

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> projectileIDs
        An ArrayList that contains the ID numbers corresponding with each of the Projectile objects in the CopyOnWriteArrayList.

      • keys

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> keys
        An ArrayList of Integers that contains the integer equivalents of the keys that are being pressed pressed at any one moment in time while the game is running.

      • map

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage map
        The BufferedImage object corresponding to the tileset map that should be used to construct the graphical map.

      • collisionMap

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage collisionMap
        The BufferedImage object corresponding to the collision map which is never painted but used to determine what elements should be placed within the collisionRecs ArrayList.

      • paintMap

        private java.awt.image.BufferedImage paintMap
        The BufferedImage object corresponding to the actual graphical map that will be painted within the game. Constructed from the map object.

      • socketServer

        private com.elveskevtar.divebomb.net.GameServer socketServer
        A GameServer object which handles all of the serverside multiplayer aspects of an MP gamemode. Is never initialized in SP gamemodes.

      • socketClient

        private com.elveskevtar.divebomb.net.GameClient socketClient
        A GameClient object which handles all of the clientside multiplayer aspects of an MP gamemode. Is never initialized in SP gamemodes.

      • graphicsMap

        private com.elveskevtar.divebomb.maps.Map graphicsMap
        This variable stores the map of the game in a Map object. The Map object is an easier way to store the BufferedImages of the collision map and graphical map, their respective file paths, and the ID number of the map.

      • frame

        private javax.swing.JFrame frame
        The JFrame object for the window in which this Game object, as a JPanel, is painted within.

      • timer

        private java.util.Timer timer
        This Timer object controls the TimerTasks that makes the game work.

        private java.lang.String userRanged
        The String object that represents the user's ranged weapon.

        The String object that represents the user's melee weapon.

      • userName

        private java.lang.String userName
        The String object that represents the user's username.

      • userRace

        private java.lang.String userRace
        The String object that represents the user's race.

      • serverIP

        private java.lang.String serverIP
        The String object that represents the IP that the user is connected to in multiplayer games. If the user is also hosting a server (or there is no user at all), this IP is set to 'localhost'.

      • user

        private com.elveskevtar.divebomb.race.Player user
        Represents the Player object for the user. Remains unused for server only games since their is no game user.

      • running

        private boolean running
        Keeps track of when the game is running. This should be true any point the game is being painted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(int gameID,
            javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        The general constructor for any Game type object that involves a client. This can be for SP gamemodes, hosting a MP gamemode with an attached client, or joining a MP gamemode from a client. Mainly just sets values for the JPanel component and some default values for the user.
        Parameters:
        gameID - The ID number associated with the game type based on the GameType enumeration.
        frame - The JFrame object in which the Game component will be added.
        See Also:
        Game.GameTypes

      • Game

        public Game(int gameID)
        The constructor specifically used for servers with no clients involved. User variables and parameters are not applicable since no client means no user. The JFrame parameter is not applicable either since servers run on the console. When there is no client, and only a server, only certain threads are needed which are specified in different methods with statement like if (getSocketClient() == null && getSocketServer() != null).
        Parameters:
        gameID - The ID number associated with the game type based on the GameType enumeration.
        See Also:
        Game.GameTypes

    • Method Detail

      • updatePlayer

        public void updatePlayer()
        Updates the user's variables such as race, color, name, melee weapon, ranged weapon, and the weapon in hand.
        See Also:
        Player

      • startGame

        public void startGame(com.elveskevtar.divebomb.maps.Map map)
        Typically called by either the GameClient object or the constructors of Game type subclasses. Officially starts the game by setting maps, updating the collisionRecs ArrayList, updating the user, adding listeners, and setting the timers.
        Parameters:
        map - The Map object used that must be passed to map collision boxes and start the game.

      • startPublicServerGame

        public void startPublicServerGame(com.elveskevtar.divebomb.maps.Map map)
        Starts online game that does not involve a side along client. Does not necessarily have to a 'public' server, it only has to a MP gamemode type that is serverside only.
        Parameters:
        map - The Map object used that must be passed to map collision boxes and start the game.

      • setTimers

        public void setTimers()
        Sets the general timers used for all gamemodes. Takes into account the presence of socketClients and socketServers.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The overriden paint method; this branches off into other paint methods based on the state variable.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object that is passed to the other paint methods

      • paintGame

        public void paintGame(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the general aspects of the actual game itself such as the players, names, projectiles, maps, and other images that are needed for every gamemode. More specialized things such as GUI and gamemode specific objects should be painted in the overriden paintGame(Graphics g) methods of Game's subclasses. The Graphics g parameter that is passed to this method is turned into a Graphics2D object for more specialized painting.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used to paint the game.

      • paintPauseMenu

        public void paintPauseMenu(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method is usually called immediately after calling public void paintGame(Graphics g) so that the pause menu serves as an overlay and gamemodes that do not pause, such as MP gamemodes, can continue in the background. There are typically changes to the contents of the pause menu based on the gamemode type.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used to paint the pause menu.

      • paintReconnect

        public void paintReconnect(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method is usually called immediately after calling public void paintGame(Graphics g) so that the game is still painted underneath the reconnect screen which only serves as an overlay to notify the user of connection issues.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used to paint the reconnect screen.
